# Task

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.



# Data

extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""")

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    pattern = r"```julia[\s\S]*?```"
    # Match all occurrences of the pattern in the markdown document
    matches = eachmatch(pattern, md)
    # Initialize an empty string to hold the extracted code
    code_str = ""
    # Iterate over matches and append the content of each code block to `code_str`
    for match in matches
        # Extract the code block text from the match
        code_block = match.match[3:end - 3]
        # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the code block
        clean_code_block = replace(code_block, r"\s+" => " ")
        # Append the clean code block to `code_str` with a newline
        code_str *= "$clean_code_block\n"
    end
    return code_str
end

# Example usage:
md = """```julia
println("hello world")
```"""
extract_julia_code(md) # Should return "println(\"hello world\")\n"
